lead_paragraph: Mr. Worsley abandoned his 1,000-mile trek only 30 miles from his goal after suffering from exhaustion and dehydration.

byline.contributor: Christine Hauser, Doris Burke and Susan Beachy contributed reporting.

snippet: Mr. Worsley abandoned his 1,000-mile trek only 30 miles from his goal after suffering from exhaustion and dehydration.

headline.main: Henry Worsley, a British Adventurer Trying to Cross Antarctica, Dies at 55
headline.print_headline: Henry Worsley, a British Adventurer Trying to Cross Antarctica, Dies at 55

abstract: Henry Worsley, British explorer and adventurer, dies at age 55 after falling just short of goal to be first person to cross Antarctica unassisted and on foot; former career soldier was inspired by Ernest Shackleton and made trek to raise money to support wounded service members.
